response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease two 9-inch round pans, line bottoms with parchment, then lightly flour. Gather 1¾ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa, 2 cups sugar, 1½ tsp baking powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt. Sift together into large bowl.",
  "step2": "Add 2 eggs, 1 cup whole milk, ½ cup oil, 2 tsp vanilla to dry mix. Beat on medium 30 seconds until combined. Carefully pour in 1 cup hot coffee; batter will be thin. Beat 1 minute more, scraping bowl, until glossy and smooth.",
  "step3": "Divide batter evenly between pans; tap to release bubbles. Bake 30–32 minutes, until centers spring back and toothpick comes out with moist crumbs. Cool in pans 10 minutes, then invert onto racks, peel parchment, and cool completely, about 1 hour.",
  "step4": "For ganache, heat 1 cup cream to simmer; pour over 8 oz chopped dark chocolate. Let stand 2 minutes, whisk until silky. Chill 30 minutes, stirring, until spreadable. Reserve ⅓ cup for drizzle; keep remainder at room temp for frosting.",
  "step5": "Level cake tops with serrated knife. Place first layer on platter; spread ⅓ ganache to edge. Top with second layer, bottom-side up. Frost top and sides thinly for crumb coat; chill 15 minutes. Apply remaining ganache, smoothing with offset spatula for sleek finish.",
  "step6": "Transfer reserved ganache to piping bag; pipe rosettes around rim. Dust center lightly with cocoa. Chill 20 minutes to set. Slice into 8 wedges with hot knife. Serve at room temperature for fudgiest texture; leftovers keep 3 days covered at cool room temperature."
}
